Who’s that?: Charlie Twokiller. Johnny’s uncle.

ᎦᎪ ᎾᏍᎩ?: ᎤᎭ ᎤᏔᎾ ᎠᏜᏗᏝᎢ. ᏗᎦᏚᎲ ᏓᏰᏏ ᎨᎵᎠ.
Who’s that?: He has a big car. He’s going to town, I guess.
Where’s Johnny now?

ᎦᎪ ᎾᏍᎩ?: ᏓᎵᏆ ᎨᎵᎠ, ᏪᏙᎭ ᏣᎵ ᎾᎿᏍᏊ ᏓᏰᏏ.
Who’s that?: Tahlequah, I guess. Charlie’s going there too.
Johnny Twokiller is a good man.
That’s right. Charlie’s good too.
Does Johnny have a car too?
Yes. He has (one).
Is Charlie Johnny’s only living uncle?
That’s right. He’s the only one.
Hello. I’m John Twokiller.
Hello. Bill Brown is my name.
Good. It sure is a pretty day.
Yes, a good day.
I’ve been told that you talk Cherokee.
No. I don’t talk very much (because) I’m white.
But I speak a few words.
You talk real good.
Does your wife also talk Cherokee?

ᎦᎪ ᎾᏍᎩ?: ᏅᎩᎭ ᎢᎧᏁᏨ ᎧᏁᎪᎢ: “ᎣᏏᏲ, ᎰᏩ, ᎮᏍᏗ,” ᎠᎴ “ᎥᏝ.”
Who’s that?:
She says just four words: “hello, okay, stop it,” and “no”.
ᏳᏩᏁᎦ ᎣᏍᏗᏬᎾᎭ, ᎠᏎᏃ ᎢᎠᎩᎸᏉᏗ ᏣᎳᎩ ᎠᎩᏬᏂᎯᏍᏗᎢ.	We (she and I) talk English but I like to talk Cherokee.
